{{Infobox television | show_name = Mara Clara | image = [[File:MaraClara2010.png|250px]] | format = [[Family]], [[Drama]] | creator = Emil Cruz, Jr. | director = Jerome Chavez Pobocan
Claudio "Tots" Sanchez-Mariscal IV | starring = [[Kathryn Bernardo]]
[[Julia Montes]] | opentheme = "''Mara Clara''" by [[Carol Banawa]] | country = [[Philippines]] | language = [[Filipino language|Filipino]], [[English language|English]] | num_episodes = 158 (final) | num_seasons = 2 | executive_producer = Jennifer Borja-Soliman | runtime = 30-45 minutes | network = [[ABS-CBN]] | picture_format = [[NTSC]] ([[480i]]) | first_aired = October 25, 2010 | last_aired = June 3, 2011 | preceded_by = ''[[1DOL]]'' | followed_by = | related = [[Mara Clara]] (Original) | website = http://www.abs-cbn.com/Weekdays/article/8918/maraclara/Mara-Clara.aspx }} '''''Mara Clara''''' is a Philippine [[soap opera|television drama]] which aired on [[ABS-CBN]] from 2010 to 2011. It is a remake is based on the 1992 original television series of the [[Mara Clara|same name]].[http://www.abs-cbn.com/Weekdays/article/8918/maraclara/Mara-Clara.aspx Mara Clara: Feature Article] retrieved via www.abs-cbn.com 10-23-2010[http://www.abs-cbn.com/Feature/Article/8921/Mara-Clara-aims-to-please-new-viewers-and-fans-of-the-original-series.aspx Mara Clara aims to please new viewers and fans of the original series] retrieved via www.abs-cbn.com 10-25-2010 ==Overview== ===Adaptation=== {{main|Mara Clara}} Mara Clara is a remake of the 1992 television series, ''[[Mara Clara]]'' an adapted novel and serial of Emil Cruz Jr. produced by [[ABS-CBN]]. In 1996, the original TV series was adapted into a film where the whole cast reprised their role except for Eruel Tongco's character Gary Davis who was played by William Martinez in the movie due to Tongco's death. In August 2010, ABS-CBN announced that they have decided to remake the television serieshttp://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/08/27/10/abs-cbn-revives-hit-soap-mara-clara with [[Kathryn Bernardo]] slated for the role of Mara opposite [[Julia Montes]] as Clara.[http://www.pep.ph/news/26941/Kathryn-Bernardo-and-Julia-Montes-topbill-ABS-CBNs-remake-of-%3Cem%3EMara-Clara%3C-em%3E Kathryn Bernardo and [[Julia Montes]] topbill ABS-CBN's remake of Mara Clara] retrieved via www.pep.ph 09-29-2010 ===Synopsis=== The story is about two girls that were switched at birth. One girl was named Mara, and she grew up as a nice, intelligent, sweet, down-to-earth girl from a very poor family. The other girl was named Clara, a mean, spoiled, intelligent, but a very rich young lady. They both went to the same school and became very close friends. Then Clara thought Mara was just being friends with her because she thinks Mara is trying to steal everything away from her. Then Clara starts to hate Mara fully as a form of revenge and makes Mara's life wretched. They do not know that Clara was supposed to be Mara, and Mara was supposed to be Clara, which means Mara was supposed to be the prosperous one and Clara was supposed to be the impoverished one. Will Mara and Clara ever find out who they really are? ==Cast== ===Main cast=== *[[Kathryn Bernardo]] as Mara David / Mara del Valle *[[Julia Montes]] as Clara del Valle /Clara David ===Supporting cast=== *[[Mylene Dizon]] as Susan David *[[Jhong Hilario]] as Gary David *[[Dimples Romana]] as Alvira del Valle *[[Bobby Andrews]] as Amanthe del Valle *Ping Medina as Karlo David *[[Gina PareÃ±o]] as Lupe David *[[Jamilla Obispo]] as Lenita Santos *[[Desiree del Valle]] as Christina Borres *Tiya Pusit as Yaya Bonnel *[[Albie CasiÃ±o]] as Christian Torralba *John Manalo as Erris Reyes *Diego Loyzaga as Derrick Gonzales *[[Cherry Lou]] as Vanessa Torralba *Renzo Cruz as Mayor Nathaniel Gonzales *[[Helga Krapf]] as Carlotta Gonzales *[[Kiray|Kiray Celis]] as Desiree Francisco *[[Aria Clemente]] as Christina Jin Jin Tianghan *[[EJ Jallorina]] as Butch Mauricio ==Reception== ===Ratings=== The series became a top rater on its primetime slot. [http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/8091/abs-cbn39s-mara-clara-and-mmk-claimed-top-spot-in-april-2011-based-on-data-from-kantar-media#39;s-%20Mara-Clara%20-and-%20MMK-%20claimed-top-spot-in-April-2011,-based-on-data-from-Kantar-Media] On June 3, 2011, on the series finale, it reached a 43.4% nationwide beating its rival from the other network ''[[Munting Heredera]]'' and ''[[Secret Garden (TV series)|Secret Garden]]'' garnering only 14.8% and 14.2%, respectively.[http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/8280/mara-clara-finale-reaches-434-percent-rating-nationwide-based-on-kantar-media-reaches-top-slot-in-twitter-trending-topics Mara Clara finale reaches 43.4 percent rating nationwide based on Kantar Media; reaches top slot in Twitter trending topics] ==Awards and nominations== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin:1em 1em 1em 0; background:#f9f9f9; border:1px #aaa solid; border-collapse:collapse; competes with Korea's ''The Baker King'']|| Soap Operas and Telenovelas || Cast || {{nom}} |- | 2011 || rowspan="2"| [[ASAP (variety show)|ASAP Pop Viewer's Choice Awards]] || Pop Kapamilya TV Show || Cast || {{nom}} |- | 2011 || Pop Kapamilya TV Character || Kathryn Bernando as Mara and Julia Montes as Clara || {{nom}} |- | 2011 || rowspan="3"| 2011 Golden Screen TV Awards[http://www.pep.ph/news/31660/Golden-Screen-TV-Awards-nominees-bared http://www.pep.ph/news/31660/Golden-Screen-TV-Awards-nominees-bared] || Outstanding Adapted Drama Series || Cast || {{Won}} |- | 2011 || Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series || Jhong Hilario || {{nom}} |- | 2011 || Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series || Mylene Dizon || {{nom}} |- | 2011 || [[PMPC Star Awards for TV| 25th Star Awards for TV]][http://www.pep.ph/news/31678/25th-star-awards-for-tv-nominees-bared] || Best Drama Actor || Jhong Hilario || {{nom}} |- |} ==See also== *[[List of shows previously aired by ABS-CBN]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.abs-cbn.com/Weekdays/article/8918/maraclara/Mara-Clara.aspx Official website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Mara Clara (2010 Tv Series)}} [[Category:ABSâCBN Corporation]] [[Category:Philippine television series]] [[Category:2010 Philippine television series debuts]] [[Category:Philippine drama]]
